intro: Monticalia carupana, commonly known as the Carupana waxplant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
